intro: Eupatorium caaguazuense var. genuinum, commonly known as the Caaguazú eupatorium, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Paraguay. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically blooms with purple to pink flowers, which attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetland or riparian habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
